intro: Pellionia griffithiana var. paucinervis, commonly known as the slender-veined pellionia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves with few veins, giving it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including India and Malaysia, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a houseplant or in tropical gardens.
